DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess palliative care physician ' attitude , beliefs practice pattern related parenteral hydration end life Latin America Spain . Objectives : 1 . To assess palliative care physician ' attitude , beliefs practice pattern related parenteral hydration end life Latin America Spain . 2 . To assess cross-national difference practice pattern related parenteral hydration end life . ( Latin America vs. Spain ) . 3 . To determine percentage physician practice parenteral hydration end-of-life hospital set home setting . 4 . To examine association provider ' parenteral hydration practice pattern : - 1. provider demographic characteristic ; - 2. specific characteristic practice setting ; - 3. training experience end life care ; 5 . To determine factor predict practice parenteral hydration end life among palliative care physician .
DOC.brief_title: Physician Perceptions About Parenteral Hydration Latin America Spain
DOC.detailed_description: This study collaboration MD Anderson 's Departments Palliative care Rehabilitation Medicine , Health Disparities Research , Latin American Association Palliative Care ( ALCP ) Spanish Society Palliative Care ( SECPAL ) . The propose study involve 10-15 minute online survey palliative care physician Latin America Spain ass attitude , beliefs practice pattern related parenteral hydration end life .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Palliative care physician practice Latin America Spain affiliate either ALCP SECPAL . 2 . Physicians must report dedicate least 30 % practice palliative care . 3 . Physician must 18 year age old . 1 ) None
